column4: how can I find out what device is my external usb hd is plugged into?
it does not mount and there is no message
I read the log of dmesg, and it says it's sdb1, but when I try to mount "sudo mount -t ntfs-3g /dev/sdb1 /media/MEDIA" it doesn't mount
does it spit out another error in dmesg
it did mount two days ago, but now it won't anymore, how can I find why?
look at /var/log/messages they are dated so you can probably guess at around what time it decided to alter its behaviour
and those would be the ones I would bring up here
there doesn't seem to be any error in the logs
the reported bug iis if you dont shutdown windows cleanly your ntfs will refuse to mount
so it won't show an eror message in Linux

I have a windows xp machine right beside me, I connect the plug, it loads the drive. I disconnect (through the "safely disconnect the drive") and it disconnect. now I plug the thing on this computer... nothing
i dont think it has to do with safely unplugging
on Ubuntu 8.04, there was an error message about "dirty ntfs" and I used to force mount and it worked. but since I "safely disconnect" in windows XP, it always worked. but not anymore
got a live CD somewhere? i'm running out of options
